theory.introduction: Strings are used to store text data like names, messages, or any sequence of characters.
theory.explanation: You can create a string by wrapping characters inside single (`'`) or double (`"`) quotes. Python provides useful methods to manipulate strings like converting to lowercase, uppercase, or checking length.
keyPoints: Strings are enclosed in quotes: `'text'` or `"text"`
Use `len()` to get the number of characters

codeExamples.explanation: Converts the string to all uppercase
Shows the number of characters in the string
